channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY

Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1266, Perfumery products, 1263, Paint, 1944 Matches, safety Class 3 Class 3, Class 4.1 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle Packaging Type: Bottle Packaging Type: Book Material of Construction: Glass Material of Construction: Glass Material of Construction: Paper Package Capacity: 10 mL Package Capacity: 15 mi Package Capacity: 20 g Amount in Package: 10mL Amount in Package: 15 mi Amount in Package: 20 g Number in Shipment: 1 Number in Shipment: 5 Number in Shipment: 2 Number Failed: 1 Number Failed: 5 Number Failed: 2

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Inbound manager noticed the damaged hazmat in the unload and informed QA to start the damaged hazmat process. DescribePack: Loose caps on the inner packages caused the liquid to leak within the box and onto the floor. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately contained into a damaged salvage drum to be inspected and processed.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer forklift operator hit a drum that was staged in the trailer with the freight he was removing consequently slightly puncturing the drum contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed in to a recovery container as was the damaged drum.

item.title: Report X-2023120285
item.description:
Report X-2023120285

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 10:20pm QA was called by the smalls manager to the unload bridge because a corrosive hazmat plastic pail was leaking on the IC belt. I brought a red hazmat bin, gloves, hazmat bag and towels to retrieve the hazmat and clean up the spill on the IC belt. DescribePack: The plastic pail got punctured on the bottom and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I brought a red hazmat bin, gloves, hazmat bag and towels to retrieve the hazmat and clean up the spill on the IC belt.

item.title: Report E-2023120117
item.description:
Report E-2023120117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 11/08/2023, a Veolia employee from the Schenectady, NY office was unloading drums from a truck into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility when the employee noticed that a drum was leaking from the gasket of the lid of the 551A2 drum. The faulty gasket allowed for mineral oil to leak out of the drum. The mineral oil was used to coat the reactive lithium in the drum. No actual lithium was released from the drum. The 551A2 lid was opened and the gasket of the drum was inspected and found to be defective and had allowed mineral oil to seep out. The gasket on the drum was replaced and the entire drum was overpacked into an 85 gallon 1A2 salvage drum. Transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued.

item.title: Report E-2023120110
item.description:
Report E-2023120110

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to a forklift accident, 2Gal AIC PH Equalizer (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The released product was contained and absorbed in the box and pallet. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released damaged jug and impacted box were placed into a 5 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to the belt to check on package upon further inspection QA saw that the item was leaking and thus item was pulled away and contained and processed after DescribePack: Paint can inside wasn't properly sealed nor did it had clips to keep it closed DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was pulled away as soon as item was discovered to be leaking item was placed in a yellow 20 gallon bucket
